page.title: 10BARNWELL PARK - INTRODUCTION
page.content: Barnwell Park is a park situated about 1 mile just south of{Oundle}on the A605 Thrapston Road.The river Nene runs around one side of the park.A country park is basically a large area of country side,just outside towns and cities.These are for people who want to see the country side, go fishing etc. Barnwell Country Park covers approximately 37 acres of which 15 acres are ponds and lakes.The park is open from 9.30am to 6.00pm in the summer and 9.30am to dusk in the winter.The park has not always been a park. Before it was a gravel works and before that it was a farm.The park is owned by Northants County Council and it employs 3 people,1 full time,1 weekend warden and a YTS trainee.
